properties.description: Posted by Nabaclish

properties.name: Bishop & The Belcher
properties.description: Posted by Nabaclish175 Bloor Street East, Toronto, ONGood food and beer in downtown Toronto! I\'ve only been there once, but it was a great experience, with friendly staff, good food and a great selection of beer.

properties.name: Buffalo Wild Wings (aka BW3)
properties.description: Posted by Nabaclish268 High St, morgantown, wvMorgantown\'s BW3 is a great place for snacks and beer, especially with the hefty 23 oz pints and great selection of draft beer. NTN is available to play as well!

properties.name: Cohen, Sam & Sons
properties.description: Posted by Nabaclish1150 E Maiden St Washington, PA (724) 222-0400 Mon - Fri 0800 - 1630 *** Cash Only, No Plastic!! ***

properties.name: El Fumador
properties.description: Posted by Nabaclish518 Beaver St. Sewickley, PA 412) 741-1300 Mon - Sat 1000-1800 Closed Sun & Holidayshttp://elfumador.com/

properties.name: Foxhead Pub/Foxburg Inn
properties.description: Posted by Nabaclish Foxburg, PAThis excellent brew pub is situated across the road from the Foxburg Winery. Be sure to check out the Winery and taste some of their excellent fruit wines! Then head over to the Foxhead Pub for some delicous and reasonably priced food and craft beer! Also, you can buy a big, beautiful 2L growler with a swing top (much like a giant Groelsch bottle) full of craft beer to take home. Then, use the growler to bottle your own homebrew! Talk about recycling. :D

properties.name: Jack's Fillin' Station
properties.description: Posted by Nabaclish948 Simcoe Street North, Oshawa ONGreat little bar to go and play NTN at. Try the Honey Garlic Wings -- they rock!

properties.name: Jester's Court Pub & Eatery
properties.description: Posted by Nabaclish279 Queen Street Port Perry ON CAMy brother and I had a pint here when our grandma was in the hospital. Crappy circumstances, good pub. The pub, which is a restored Victorian home, is reputed to be haunted, but we didn\'t see anything wierd.

properties.name: Kawartha Lakes Brewing Co. -- R.I.P.
properties.description: Posted by Nabaclish687 Rye Street, Peterborough, OntarioSadly, KLB closed it\'s doors in 2003 after creating wonderful craft beer since 1996: http://www.beerme.com/breweries/ca/on/2361.shtml Too bad, because they made an awsome raspberry wheat beer. :(

properties.name: Kingston Brewing Company
properties.description: Posted by Nabaclish34 Clarence St., Kingston, ONOne of the original brew pubs in Ontario (due to wierd liquor control laws), try all their great beers that are brewed right on the premises. They even pour their brews with an antique beer engine (sort of an ancestor to the modern keg tap). I highly recommend their Dragon\'s Breath Ale, and be sure to try their wings as well -- they are awesome!

properties.name: Leaf & Bean
properties.description: Posted by Nabaclish2200 Penn Ave Pittsburgh, PA (412) 434-1480 Mon - Fri 0600-1600 Sat. 0700-1600 Sun. 0900-1500

properties.name: Maine Street Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Nabaclish  297 Main St, Bar Harbor, ME 04609While on a road trip to Prince Edward Island with one of my best friends, Rick, we heard an advert for this place on the radio. We spontanously decided to go there for lunch, and this is the first place that I tried two great things for the first time: Lobster and Blueberry Ale. Both were excellent, and I highly recommend them together or seperate. :D

properties.name: Mixer's (Gay Bar)
properties.description: Posted by Nabaclish204 Coleman Street, Olean, NY 14760Nice little pub with queer clientele! Good selection of bottles, OK selection of taps, and an electronic DART MACHINE! In my experience, all the customers and the owner were really cool, but the two straight male bartenders were jerkwads. They were just unfriendly, ineffecient and surly. However, I have it on good information that the other bartenders are great, and since I\'ve only been there once, I must reserve judgement. :)

properties.name: Molly Brannigans
properties.description: Posted by Nabaclish506 State St, Erie, PAA bit on the pricey side, but this pub has world class food and a wonderful atmosphere, complete with a fireplace, leather couches, brass and taps as far as the eye can see! Try the Guinness Beef Stew!

properties.name: Olde Stone Brewing Company
properties.description: Posted by Nabaclish380 George St. N., Peterborough, OntarioGreat little historic place with great beer!

properties.name: Pittsburgh Cigar Co
properties.description: Posted by Nabaclish8501 Perry Hwy Pittsburgh, PA (412) 635-7784

properties.name: Poor Richard's Tobacconist
properties.description: Posted by Nabaclish125 W Station Square Dr. Pittsburgh, PA (412) 281-1133 Mon - Sat 1000-2100 Sun 1200-1700

properties.name: Route 19 Beer & Cigar
properties.description: Posted by Nabaclish3626 Washington Rd. Mc Murray, PA (724) 941-2345

properties.name: Slight Indulgence
properties.description: Posted by NabaclishSlight Indulgence 3200 Collins Ferry Rd. Morgantown, WV (304) 599-3402 Mon - Fri 0730-1800 Sat 0900-1800 Closed Sundays

properties.name: Smoker Friendly
properties.description: Posted by Nabaclish736 Venture Dr. Morgantown, WV (304) 292-8809

properties.name: Smoker Friendly/Cigar Express #5
properties.description: Posted by Nabaclish20880 US Route 19 Cranberry, PA (724) 453-1044 Mon - Sat 0600-1900

properties.name: The Brewer's Art
properties.description: Posted by Nabaclish 1106 N. Charles Street, Baltimore, MDDidn\'t get a chance to go in (they were closed), but I did have a chance to taste their Resurrection Ale in a nearby pub that they sell their beers through. Brewer\'s Art specializes in Belgian style beers, and I urge you to check them out, or try their beers in any way you can!

properties.name: The Hare & The Hound
properties.description: Posted by Nabaclish15 Simcoe St. N. Oshawa, ONGreat pub with atmosphere and food to match!

properties.name: The Heart and The Crown
properties.description: Posted by Nabaclish67 Clarence St, Ottawa, ONI enjoyed pints of Guinness on the deck of this Irish style pub in Canada\'s Capital. The moderate sized pub got crowded fast that weekend night, so the deck was the safest place to be. Great live Celtic drinking music, too!

properties.name: The Thirsty Monk
properties.description: Posted by Nabaclish36 Athol Street East, Oshawa, Ontario L1J 8L5Great place for a few pints of beer. My hometown \'stomping ground\'.

properties.name: Tir Na Nog
properties.description: Posted by Nabaclish200 Ontario Street, Kingston, Ontario, CanadaNice Irish pub, right across the street from the Kingston Brewing Company! Pub crawl your way over and check it out.

properties.name: Tobacco World
properties.description: Posted by Nabaclish314 Morgantown St. Uniontown, PA 15401 (724) 438-3534 Mon - Fri 0900-1900

properties.name: West Virginia Brewing Company
properties.description: Posted by Nabaclish1291 University Avenue, Morgantown, WV, 26505The Brew Pub is a Morgantown institution. The building looks to be an old mill of some type, and it has since been converted to a brew pub/restaurant. Live music is a frequent feature at the Brew Pub, and their delicious beer is brewed on the premises and is served by the pint, pitcher or growler. Watch for daily specials too! Tuesday is Bartender\'s Choice (one flavor of beer is randomly picked and is a pint), Wednesday is pints until 10pm and Fridays are pitchers.
